main.name: Weiyuan Che(Carl)
main.description: A tech passionate hard-working computer science graduate and IT professional. Currently seeking the role of Software Developer
main.bio: Sports fan, workout enjoyer, drill rap lover and beginner Go student trying to learn the world's culture through reading while continuing my career in IT. Born in Ningbo, China, came to Toronto on a purpose.
main.contactmessage: Please message below if you have any inquiries. Looking forward to hearing from you!

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: The University of Toronto is where I completed my undergraduate studies. After 4+1 years of scrolling up and down on the course notes, aggressively typing on the lab computer late at night and repeatedly calculated the final marks, I managed to obtain knowledge on a variety of IT related topics such as coding languages, project designs, machine learning and the business of software.

certificates.title: AWS Certified Developer - Associate
certificates.description: Earned certification from Amazon Web Services (AWS) demonstrating proficiency in designing, developing, and deploying applications on the AWS platform. Validates expertise in AWS services, application development, security, troubleshooting, and cost optimization.

works.title: Quality Automation Engineer
works.description:
I help achieve automation testing on decision engines that check a person's credit status whenever a request for a new line of credit is made. I have designed and implemented a UI automation testing tool and my own automation testing framework. The tech stack currently includes Javascript, the Cucumber + Karate framework and Python. 

I am a part of a small QA team where we each have our own project to be responsible of but will help out others when needed.

works.title: Quality Assurance Analyst
works.description:
At this cloud marketing company, I automated unit, E2E and load tests for Salesforce, Infinity and WeChat integration applications using Java, testing frameworks Selenium, TestNG, Appium and testing tools Postman and Cypress. I also performed functional and regression tests regularly, documented test tickets and plans on JIRA and Confluence pages. On one occasion I developed features of a mock service API for testing with RESTful design using Java.

This is where I learned the basics of being a tech professional. I had an in-depth understanding of the roadmap-to-release cycle of a software and Agile developing environment.

works.title: IT Department Intern Developer
works.description: Within the time period of two months I finished a few tasks including making front-end changes to a mobile banking application using JavaScript, React and Vue, analyzing the back-end system structure of the mobile banking application and developing features of a SSO web application in both back-end(RESTful API) using Java, SprintBoot and front-end(web pages) using JavaScript. I also performed manual tests on a city-wide integration system for bank transfer records.
